meanings.definition: To surpass in foolishness or stupidity.
meanings.sent1: Tom always manages to outfools his friends with his silly pranks.
meanings.sent2: She outfools everyone in the class with her ridiculous excuses.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to outfools the magician, but ended up making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to outfools the expert backfired, revealing his own foolishness.
meanings.sent5: The jester's antics never fail to outfools the audience.

meanings.definition: To outwit or deceive someone by acting foolishly.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox outfools the hunter by pretending to be injured.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outfools her opponents in the game of chess.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to outfools the audience, but they saw through his act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's plan to outfools the detective was foiled by a simple mistake.
meanings.sent5: The trickster's ability to outfools others made him famous in the town.
